STACK A: RIVAL IMPRINTS
Circulation Desk Open Until Moonset

Two sibling ovens. One city of sleepless readers. Every page traced in wax and resolve.

Our twin bakers publish practical books for hard evenings: how to begin again, how to keep your hands steady, how to forgive the hour. Manuscripts are drafted in crayon at the long tables, proofed under amber lamps, and released by dawn with a warm loaf slip.

  • Volume I, Hearth Discipline: twelve rituals for mornings that arrive too fast.
  • Volume II, Quiet Crumbs: a workbook for recovering after public failure.
  • Volume III, The Second Rise: rebuilding confidence after the first collapse.

Current shelf note: "Move slowly enough that your breath can keep up."

STACK B: NIGHT ACCESS

After-Hours Reading Pass

The lamps stay lit for members who need an extra chapter before sleep. A custard bell rings at 01:10 and 03:40. Silence between bells is maintained by the floor cats.

$18 / month

Includes one annotated loaf card per week, one shelf consult, and overnight borrowing from the Resilience Wing.
STACK C: MEMBERSHIP TIERS

Reader Plans

Lantern Tier — $9/month. Weekly checkouts and margin coaching in the East Annex.

Ember Tier — $24/month. Full archive access, crayon draft studio, loaf credit every Friday.

Nocturne Tier — $46/month. Priority reservations, private mezzanine carrel, seasonal binding set.

Enrollment windows close on the last dusk of each month.

STACK D: QUALITY COUNCIL

Certified by the Feline Review Board

"If the page cannot survive a paw at midnight, it is not ready for public shelves."

Each title undergoes claw-resistance, nap-duration, and lap-settle testing. Council signatures appear on every spine before circulation.

Current chair: Archivist Miso, 7th winter term.
